message: Fuck Star Trek, Stargate SG-1 is the best show ever.
Have you watched SG:U much? I think it's right up there with Firefly, with the latter being my #1 all-time fave show. (next in Sci-Fi category: SGU, Dollhouse, SG-1 and then TNG)
Hmmm, I can see that. Not that I was ever bothered by anyone, though.
I did really like how Claudia Black filled the void of RDA in the latest seasons, she is tremendously cool and funny.
Oh, as the kind of comedic relief character?
I loooooooooved firely, wasn't too much into Dollhouse. SG:U was... hm.
I liked it, and I fucking loved some of the characters in there, mainly Robert Carlyle, because I fucking love Robert Carlyle, but I couldn't really get into the show.
Too many annoying people in the way.
RDA?
I just found that SG-1 was fun, but not particularly deep or solid in story-telling / writing most of the time. It was consistently entertaining and nice sci-fi though.
Basically, but also to keep things interesting in general. Teal'c, Daniel and Sam are all kind of the well-reasoned and calculating ones. No excitement if that's all you have. :)
Richard Dean Anderson
SGU was lame
SG-1 was amazing and SGA was solid
Not really, just the movie.
Well, I mean, the movie _was_ rather good..
I need to watch this show
Oy!
You haven't watched _any_ Stargate?!

The movie was fantastic
But I think this might be my favorite Stargate moment of all time: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dVbICGqN1os
The little snort in his voice when he says the line "Unless you get cute…"  is just so phenomenally perfect.
ugh, how can anyone think SGU is the best
I'm looking for the scene where Daniel is on the phone
(from 10x16 Bad Guys)
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1udI7WqjD1A
YES!
That scene indeed.  Gosh that was hard to track down, Youtube's removed (almost) all the episodes and clips of SG-1.
"there's gonna be killin, and whatnot"
I was trying to avoid spoiling the line for people who haven't seen it yet ;)
sorry
SG-U fit a different niche than SG-1, but I enjoyed it more than SG-1. By the end of SG-1 and SG-A they had so many secret weapons and technology that it got a little ridiculous.
What was your (anyone else's) main element of SG-1 that they liked?
Yeah, it's a very different class of show altogether, SGU. But what I liked about it so much is that it was more about deep space exploration, whereas SG-1 was never much about that, in the end.

SG-1 was very formulaic in that the average episode can be summed up with "SG-1 goes to a planet, encounters more humans, problem arises, SG-1 saves the day, humanity one step closer to salvation from the [Replicators || Goa'uld]"
The sense of otherworldly exploration was never reached in the same way it was in the original movie, but in SG:U, I feel like it came back.
see I loved the constant pushing of humanity
the furthering our understanding of our world
Maybe it's the despair of their situation which, IMO, is written really well into the whole show.
I didn't mind that, but it's definitely a far stride from SG-1 and SGA
my favorite part of hte harry potter books was also the bit at the end where everything gets explained :)
Yeah, it wasn't _bad_, but to me, Stargate was originally all about the thrill and excitement of exploring other worlds and finding non-Earthly things out there in space.
And half the time I kinda missed that element in SG-1, but even when things happen all aboard the Destiny in SG:U, I still feel like that element is there.
SGU had no sense of humor :(
There was no real comic relief, no.
The humor and the characters, plotwise it was the constant race to understand our own universe.
Humor and characters were definitely a great thing about it
what made you feel it was a race to understand our own universe, and not, say, a race to just beat the Goa'uld and the Replicators and, oh, if we learn something along the way that's great?
I'm two third of the way through the Stargate movie
can't believe i'd never watched it before
an action movie starring james spader! how could i miss that?
